header_summary: ZmnSCPxj asks Antoine about the suitability of using "OP_EVICT" for an unknown purpose, providing a link for reference. Vincenzo Palazzo questions the conclusion of a previous discussion on BIP 21 and suggests improving it with a new version. They mention multiple invoices in the context of lightning and express a preference for working on the grammar. MuSig and MuSig2 are explained as n-of-n signing algorithms by ZmnSCPxj. Gijs van Dam discusses the Payment Splitting & Switching plugin and its potential use in mitigating probing and/or jamming. Lloyd Fournier mentions a downside of using a MuSig API. Vincenzo Palazzo corrects a mistake in a previous post and apologizes for any confusion caused.

recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs van Dam developed the Payment Splitting & Switching (PSS) plugin for Link MPP.
- PSS allows route and amount changes without the sender's knowledge to mitigate probing.
- PSS results in up to a 62% drop in information gain compared to earlier work.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- Schnorr Musig2 will be implemented for statechains, keeping server (party 1) blinded.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.
- Party 1 does not learn the final signature or the message being signed.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The storage for blockchain is sufficient based on several factors and growth potential.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide storage for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts reduce the space needed by individual nodes, ensuring sufficient storage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has submitted a complete proposal for MATT's core opcodes, making it functionally complete.
- The proposal includes OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY as a single opcode and introduces a `flags` parameter.
- MATT's generality can be achieved with just two opcodes: OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Lightning's scalability challenge for casual users can be overcome by enabling simple covenants.
- Implementation of timeout-trees can facilitate smooth rollover of funds for Lightning users.
- Enabling CTV or APO in Bitcoin's rules can make Lightning a widely-used payment method.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and the inability to resume channel operations with static backups.
- The proposal suggests using OP_CAT and OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK to detect revoked states and save bandwidth.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository [1] regarding a simple architecture for secure commands in a lightning node using an HSM.
- The architecture requires minimal changes to the lightning node and utilizes custom lightning messages.
- Bastien suggests implementing the idea and offers to provide specifications and review the implementation.
